definition: non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
strong-smelling vegetable (garlic etc)/non-vegetarian food (meat, fish etc)/vulgar/obscene
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Russian cuisine is famous for its soups such as borscht and meat dishes.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯菜以它的各种汤和荤菜著名于世。

sentences.english: Egg is easy to cooked so the meat should be cooked before.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋是很容易蒸熟的，所以这些荤菜需要事先煮过。

sentences.english: Russian cuisine is famous for its soups, such as borscht and meat dishes.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯菜以它的各种汤和荤菜闻名于世。
我想要一份开胃菜与荤菜。

sentences.english: We were offered a choice of meat or vegetarian dishes and he chose the vegetarian diet.
sentences.chinese: 开饭的时候，有荤菜或素食可选，他选择了素食。

sentences.english: Well, one portion has two meat dishes and one vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 哦，一份饭有两样荤菜和一样蔬菜。

sentences.english: He has opened a store selling cold meet. Because the food is cheap and good, the business is prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 他开了一个冷荤菜小店，由于物美价廉，生意很红火。
